attributes.action: Hold a general election to "establish a mandate from the British people"
attributes.additional_details:
On his first day as PM, Boris Johnson rules out an election till 2022. 

Yet in 2007 he publicly condemned Gordon Brown as being in Office “without a mandate from the British people.”  This article from the New Statesman further quotes Boris Johnson on his appointment as PM without general election.  

https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2019/06/without-mandate-british-people-how-boris-johnson-described-gordon-brown-2007?fbclid=IwAR3YkVjGLc2FKZeckdpESVM6sYtbTJ00FE7Yk-UBnU4amDeKCYK_ZofpveQ
attributes.background: Today the Conservative Party announced their new leader who has become Prime Minister without a general election.  Yet Boris Johnson previously condemned such acts as arrogant, contempt for democracy and a gigantic fraud.  To honour his own words, he now needs " a mandate from the British people".
